name: Ch11BBaseConvo4
_source: speak;Joshua;Urgh...|Who knew the sea could be so...|unpleasant?
speak;Joshua;I'm fine, Father Moulder.|Just getting my sea legs, as they say.
speak;Moulder;You don't look well at all, my boy.|The complexion of your face reminds me of the time|Garcia ate those questionable mushrooms.
speak;Moulder;Perhaps I can offer some assistance?|My healing arts extend beyond battle wounds.
speak;Joshua;I wouldn't turn down help right now.|What did you have in mind?
speak;Moulder;A simple herbal remedy and a minor healing spell.|It won't cure seasickness entirely,|but it should ease your discomfort.
speak;Joshua;...Hmm, not as bitter as I expected.
speak;Joshua;I'm already feeling a bit better.|You're a lifesaver, Father Moulder.
speak;Moulder;Happy to help.|I take it you don't have much experience with ocean travel?
speak;Joshua;Let's just say I'm more accustomed to a different kind of sea.|One that doesn't move quite so...unpredictably.
speak;Moulder;A different kind of sea?|Ah, you mean the deserts.
speak;Moulder;Your complexion, for one.|Despite your current pallor, your skin bears the mark of someone|who has spent considerable time under a harsh sun.
speak;Moulder;And your clothing style has elements of the eastern regions.|Jehanna, perhaps?
speak;Joshua;You've got sharp eyes, Father.|Yes, I've spent time in...those parts.
speak;Moulder;The "Sea of Sand," they call it.|I visited once in my younger days.|Beautiful, but unforgiving.
speak;Joshua;That it is.|The desert demands respect.|Much like the ocean, it seems.
speak;Joshua;Though I think I prefer sand that stays in one place|to water that can't make up its mind.
speak;Moulder;Both can be treacherous in their own ways.|The desert hides its dangers beneath the surface,|while the sea flaunts them with every wave.
speak;Joshua;You know, I never thought of it that way.|The desert is deceptive, quiet in its danger.|The sea is honest about its threats.
speak;Moulder;Perhaps that's why you're struggling.|You're used to reading subtle signs of danger,|not confronting them so...viscerally.
speak;Joshua;Maybe you're right.|In the desert, you learn to read the wind, the sand patterns.|Here, I'm at the mercy of these waves.
speak;Moulder;Give it time.|A man who has mastered the desert|will find his footing on the sea eventually.
speak;Joshua;I hope so.|For now, I'm grateful for your remedy.|And your discretion.
speak;Joshua;Not everyone needs to know where I hail from.|A mercenary keeps some cards close to the chest, you know?
speak;Moulder;Of course.|Your secrets are safe with me, Joshua.|We all have parts of our past we choose to keep private.
speak;Moulder;The goddess sees all, but even she does not judge|the paths we walked before finding our way here.
speak;Joshua;Thanks, Father.|You know, you're all right.|For a man of the cloth.
speak;Moulder;And you're quite interesting.|For a simple "mercenary."
speak;Joshua;Ha!|Point taken.|I think I'll get some fresh air now.
speak;Moulder;A wise choice.|And if you need another dose of that remedy,|you know where to find me.
